name: Tweaks
description: A collection of common layout and style changes: hiding nonessential elements, making formatted text more readable, and handling page resizing more fluidly.

options.description: Hide the help button floating at the bottom right of the interface.
Hide the commands popup when typing '/'.

options.label: Hide Notion AI
options.description: Hide the 'Ask AI' and 'Write ... with AI' prompts.
Hide the default page icons.
Disables style animations for a snappier experience across the board. This will not affect JavaScript-powered animations, e.g. the left sidebar popping out.
Decreases page padding so every page fills the available space either side (a global toggle for the 'full width' option under page settings).
Forces horizontally scrollable inline tables to respect the width and padding of a page when they overflow.
The width of the window below which in-page columns are made full width to avoid squishing column contents.
The unit to measure the above width in, e.g. you may wish the button to appear when the window occupies <= 20% of the screen or is less than a certain number of pixels wide.
Hide the comments section at the top of pages within databases.
Increases spacing between text blocks (paragraphs) to improve readability.
Tightened line spacing between bulleted list items.
Increases the weight of bolded text from 600 (semibold) to 700 (bold), making it stand out more obviously against regular text.
Renders links Obsidian-style, surrounded with [[square brackets]] instead of underlined.
Colours links with Notion's blue colour or a theme's equivalent.
Wraps quote block content in large, decorative serif quotation marks.
Decreases code block padding to fit more naturally into the flow of text down a page.

Changes the default horizontal alignment of images embedded within pages. Note that this replaces Notion's built-in central alignment, i.e. setting this to left or right will remove the option to centre images entirely.
